children.subject: Also wanted to add that 151 may also help with appreciating the applications of the devices you learn about in 130.
Ah ok that was very helpful, thank you so much!

Content-wise, taking 105 before 130 isn't necessary. 105 does touch on some device physics, but doesn't go in depth into the derivations of various equations or cover energy-band diagrams, which are emphasized heavily in 130. As long as you are familiar with some basic thermodynamics and E&M content from Physics 7B, you should be fine. 

However, one reason (other than it briefly touching on device physics) that 105 could be useful before 130 is to give you a sense of how devices are actually implemented at the circuit level. In 130, you will learn the underlying physics of a diode in various biasing configurations or the regions of operation of a MOSFET, but you may not understand the applications to analog amplifiers or basic digital circuits until taking 105. That being said, the basic device physics you learn in 130 could be found in other applications as well outside the scope of 105, such as photovoltaics or LEDs. 

At the end of the day, 130 doesn't assume that you have taken 105, so it is not necessary to have taken it beforehand.

Re: 151 and 130, I have not taken 151, but 130 is relatively light so I would say it is doable.

history.content: Is it alright to take EE 130 before EE 105? I saw some mixed opinions about this but on HKN they recommend you take 105 before 130. Does anyone have any insight about this? Additionally, would EE 130 and EECS 151 be too much of a workload for fall semester? I wanted to take 105 first before 130 but it looks like the 151 discussion sections conflict with the 105 lectures and between the two, I'd rather take 151 in the fall to prepare for internships. Any advice would be appreciated :)
history.subject: EE 130 before EE 105

history.content: Would EE 130 and EECS 151 be too much of a workload for fall semester? I wanted to take 105 but it looks like the 151 discussion sections conflict with the lecture time of 105 and between the two, I'd rather take 151 in the fall to prepare for internships. Any insight/advice would be appreciated :)
history.subject: EE 130 + EECS 151
